events.name: Women Techmakers Switzerland Launch Ap√©ro
events.description:
We will enjoy a nice Ap√©ro together to get to know eachother, there will probably be short talks and/or a panel discussion.¬†

More details will be announced shortly.

events.name: WTM Ice-skating and Gl√ºhwein
events.description:
As part of the events WTM will be organizing, we are planning on having an informal regular meeting where women and men interested in tech and diversity can relax, discuss and get to know each other. This is the first event of its kind and it will be held at the Dolder ice-skating rink.¬†

We will be meeting at 6PM in front of the skating rink.¬†

events.name: Stammtisch (Mingle and get together with cool people)
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
We come together to discuss anything you would like to! Or we just meet and have fun. Everyone is welcome. We will enjoy drinks and coffee!

Possible topics:
What could WTM CH be about?
What do you struggle with in your daily life?
What are the amazing things you do every day?
What are some workshops, talks, things you would like to attend?
We can talk about hardships of diversity in tech and about all the good things!
Share ideas and experience. Meet amazing people!

‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know
We will announce the place soon, somewhere in the city centre. Please update your attendance if you can't make it, so we can make an accurate reservation at the place we meet. Open end!

events.name: Public speaking workshop (global diversity CFP day)(Registration required)
events.description:
Have you always wanted to become a tech conference speaker? Let 2018 be the year that you make that dream a reality!

In this full-day (8 hours) workshop, you will meet friendly mentors who're happy to guide you through the process of becoming a public speaker.

We will cover:

Finding a topic for a talk, finding a topic for a talk, finding a conference that fits you, writing a talk proposal, preparing a talk, talking on stage, tips & tricks for public speaking and we will also do a bit of on-stage training

More information here:
https://www.globaldiversitycfpday.com/events/15

‚Ä¢ What to bring
Will be announced to registered attendees.

‚Ä¢ Important to know
Please book your 10.- CHF ticket here:
https://ti.to/web-zurich/global-diversity-cfp-day

events.name: Introducing Firebase
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
We will introduce Firebase in a presentation and have a detailed look at Firebase Hosting. In order to do this, we will build our own small website and then deploy it, using Firebase.

‚Ä¢ What to bring
Bring your laptop

‚Ä¢ Important to know
The workshop is designed for beginners of Firebase

events.name: GDG & WTM Stammtisch
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Meeting interesting people, talk about tech, socialise, network or whatever floats your boat ;-)

‚Ä¢ Important to know
This is an event hosted by GDG (Google developer group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers) and aims at bringing people together and foster a diverse environment.

events.name: Machine Learning meets Yoga
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
This is a WTM Group Event (https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/) with Open Tech School. We'll introduce Machine Learning in a presentation. After it we'll relax with a yoga session with Christina Hottinger from Yoga Lab (https://www.yoga-lab.ch/team/).

‚Ä¢ What to bring
Comfortable clothes for the yoga session.

‚Ä¢ Important to know
The workshop is designed for Machine Learning beginners.

events.name: GDG & WTM Stammtisch
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Meet interesting people, talk about tech, socialise and of course network! ;-)

‚Ä¢ Important to know
This is an event hosted by GDG (Google Developer Group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers). It aims to bring like-minded people together and foster a diverse environment.

events.name: Web Components Workshop
events.description:
While the web became more powerful, web applications have become larger and more complex. To provide you with tools and strategies to build web applications in a structured way, Web Components have been created and standardized. In this workshop we will learn:
> - What Web components are and how they help us build web apps
> - How to use the web component standards to create components
> - How to integrate and combine components into an application

What to bring:
- Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
- Your laptop with a browser (preferred: Chrome or Firefox)

This workshop will be run by our lovely Martin Splitt <3

events.name: IWD 18 Conference
events.description:
Building a New Horizon
IWD 18 Conference

!!External registration required (link below)!!

This WTM conference is held in celebration of the International Women's Day 2018. It aims at bringing people together to learn and to be inspired. We will have technical and non-technical talks from professional, as well as first-time speakers, and we will have parallel workshops in the afternoon.

Attendance is free and participants will be provided with lunch and beverages throughout the day.

Find out more information about the schedule and register your ticket here:
https://iwd18.womentechmakers.ch

‚Ä¢ What to bring
For the conference you need to bring yourself! We will inform workshop participants independently.

‚Ä¢ Important to know
You need to register for a free ticket to this event. Meetup RSVP is not enough, availability is limited.

We are looking forward to a great event!

events.name: WTM & GDG Stammtisch
events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Meeting interesting people, talk about tech, socialise, network or whatever floats your boat ;-)

‚Ä¢ Important to know
This is an event hosted by GDG (Google developer group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers) and aims at bringing people together and foster a diverse environment. See also: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Zurich/

events.name: Flutter - the new kind from the block
events.description:
Details
First of all, we are happy to announce that this is our first Meetup together with the App Builders Z√ºrich community :) So join us together with the guys from App Builders on our Meeup to explore Flutter. Flutter is one of the top trending repositories on GitHub nowadays. It is Google‚Äôs mobile UI Framework to create native iOS / Android Apps and aims to revolutionise mobile app development.

************************************************

The Presentation
Patrice M√ºller (Android) and Renato Stauffer (iOS) will be talking about how Flutter works, their experience using the framework and explain how to get started. After the talk we will enjoy snacks & drinks and socialise / network.

**********************************************

About the Speakers
Renato touched iOS the first time in 2012 and never looked back since then. After graduating at Berner Fachhochschule in Business Information Systems he moved to Z√ºrich to develop iOS applications full time. He worked on many banking / P2P payment apps including Paymit (what eventually became Twint) and never got warm with cross platform development until he discovered Flutter at Google IO 2017.

Patrice started Android development back in 2010 when he was a Student at Hochschule f√ºr Technik Rapperswil . Since then he worked on many different Android / cross platform projects including SBB Mobile, Paymit and NEMO (Post) for different agencies. He started his journey in cross platform development with Mobile GWT and tried other approaches including Ionic or Xamarin. After a lot of frustration with many of the mentioned cross platform approaches he ended up linking one: Flutter

************************************************

Sponsors
The event will be held at the Swisscom Tower. So thank you Swisscome for hosting the event :) and GDG Z√ºrich for providing the refreshments.

************************************************

Event Details
Entrance is free and language will be in English.

************************************************

Present your App experiences
*If you are interested in presenting about App development, ML, etc. please contact us and we will find a date for you.

events.name: Hacker's guide to landing a job you'll love

venue.name: Impact Hub Colab - Loft Corner, 4th floor

events.description:
Career changes are among the handful of the most impactful decisions each of us is going to make in our lives. And yet so little non-superficial, common sense knowledge about these processes is available out there.

Combining his engineering perspective and experience of being involved in thousands of recruitment processes, Piotr will share how he thinks you should approach interviewing - to figure out whether a particular company is the right fit for you or not... and how to get the job if it is.

Speaker - Piotr Nedzynski
Piotr is a tech entrepreneur with software engineering background. He co-founded the first startup community in Krakow and grew it to be the biggest startup community in Poland at the time. More recently, first as a COO and then Head of Talent, he helped grow Base - the biggest startup in Poland - from 10 hackers working in an apartment to a highly effective R&D organisation of about 120

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Z√ºrich
events.description:
We are excited to announce that this years I/O Extended will be at the Google's Huerlimann campus again!

We will watch the keynote together drink some beer and talk about technology.

We will have some time to to socialize before and after the live streaming and if you would like to use the time to give a short (2-5 min) pitch about a topic, do contact us and we arrange it. This could be teasing about a possible presentation topic to gather response from the crowd or just introducing yourself to break the ice.

‚Ä¢ Important to know
This is an event hosted by GDG (Google developer group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers) and aims at bringing people together and foster a diverse environment. See also: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Zurich/

events.name: Android Advanced Topics and Performance
events.description:
Details
We are happy to announce a meetup for Android Natives. Together with Women Techmakers Zuerich and Swisscom Technologies, we have the chance to give you the opportunity to learn up to date best practices on android development.

* What to expect
Besides Flutter and Kotlin, things are still changing in the android world. With this meetup we would like to give you the possibility to learn about best practices from a performance perspective.

‚Ä¢ What we'll do
This event will be split in two parts. As a warm up, there will be a session shown from the Google IO 2018 about Advanced Topics on Android - "Protips: a fresh look at advanced topics for Android experts". After this warm up we are very happy to welcome our speaker of the evening Doug Sillars on his talk ‚ÄúPerformance of Mobile Apps‚Äù - A talk that goes over best practices, and shows examples of how improvements made mobile apps run better. After this session, feel free to ask questions to Doug and there will also be time for social networking.

* What to bring
Please bring your curiosity and excitement on the topic. If you have questions regarding the topic performance, please also take those with you

* What's the timetable for this event
18:15 opening door to the event
18:30 Start Session about ProTips
19:30 Break
19:45 Start Session about Performance of Mobile Apps
20:30 Questions/Social Networking

events.name: Digitec Galaxus: Working for and with our customers!
events.description:
Details
Would you like to know what the development process at Digitec Galaxus looks like and which methodologies do we use? Or have you ever wondered how we incorporate our user wishes and needs into our daily work? In association with Women Techmakers Zuerich we invite you all on[masked] at Pause (400m from our Z√ºrich store) to get answers to all these questions.

**Schedule**

18.00 Welcome drink

18.30 From the mind to the realization - an overview from a developer's perspective (Alicia)

18.50 Fearless Feedback - the importance of feedback in UX-Design (Ilaria)

19.10 Break

19.25 Discovering products simpler and faster - Elasticsearch at Digitec Galaxus (Snigdha)

19.55 Night Cup

More details on : https://www.digitec.ch/de/page/meetup-digitec-galaxus-einblicke-in-unsere-entwicklungsabteilung-7616

We highly encourage women participation, but needless to say, gentlemen are also welcome!

events.name: Progressive Web Apps - How to succeed in the web of tomorrow
events.description:
While the web became more powerful, it's crucial for businesses to get the most out of it. Progressive Web Apps are a big part of it and businesses worldwide have already implemented it and reached great results. In this workshop we will learn following:

>- Why PWA‚Äôs are so useful (incl. some really impressive examples)
>- How to migrate an existing web project to a PWA
>- How to make use of PWA‚Äôs best features, like sending Push notifications, Offline Content and providing Install prompts

What to bring:
- Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
- Your laptop with a browser (optional: Git and Code Editor installed)
- Good Mood üòä

We're thankful to ERNI for providing us their office space to host this event there.

events.name: [Talks & Drinks] Rethinking User Experience Design
events.description:
A good user experience is crucial to the success of a product. But how do we approach user-centric design these days? How can we structure information and organize our environments to create the best user experience?

We gladly welcome Laura Summers (https://twitter.com/summerscope) who came all the way to Australia to present alternative and component driven design processes.

As usual, we will provide snacks and drinks and a great atmosphere :)

A big thank you to JobCloud for providing us with a wonderful venue, snacks and drinks.
www.jobcloud.ch

Schedule
18:00 - 18:15 Arrival, Drinks and Conversations
18:15 - 19:00 Burn the concept mocks by Laura Summers
19:00 - 19:30 How to become a UX designer in 30 minutes by Gion Kunz
19:45 - 20:15 Machine Learning for Designers by Memi Beltrame
20:15 Drinks, Snacks and Conversations

Details

Burn the concept mocks
_____________________________________________________________________
Bring your blow torches people, because it‚Äôs time to burn some stuff down! We‚Äôll discuss the high fidelity design phase and consider alternatives. We should be refining product UI in an iterative and component-driven way that matches the development flow - based on my earlier blog post of the same name (have a read if you have time! https://blog.prototypr.io/burn-the-concept-mocks-4afe78e5f7ab). Are you ready? Let‚Äôs do it! Let‚Äôs give ourselves permission to redesign the way we design.

Laura is a multi-disciplinary designer working across user experience research, design and front-end development for startups. Asking questions, unpacking assumptions and trying to get to the bottom of things are some of her favourite activities - supported by methodologies all the cool kids are using, such as Lean, Agile and Design Thinking. She's a passionate advocate for improving diversity in technology and ensuring our workplaces are welcoming and inclusive. Also: cats rule, dogs drool.

How to become a UX designer in (50) 30 minutes
_____________________________________________________________________
Many people believe that UX designers are a rare species, descended from unicorns, who create their designs in magical clearings in the forest during full moon. Well, this is obviously not the case. Proper UX Design follows a clear and rational process. This talk is for UX unicorn believers, developers or designers who work with developers and it aims to demystify a user centered UX process by showing a practical and rational UX process from start to finish.

Machine Learning for Designers
_____________________________________________________________________
Artificial Intelligence sits at the core of the biggest transformation of our industry: the convergence of Industrial Design, Interaction Design and Service Design forming a new mega-discipline. With it comes the need for designers to evolve into new fields, one of which is Machine Learning.
This talk is about what Machine Learning is, how it is driving the change in our industry, and what of it is important for designers.

Memi is an experience designer with more backgrounds than a Wes Anderson movie. He's a college dropout (English Literature & Linguistics) and a trained film director. He's been writing code since he was 13, with absolutely no ambition other than to see what happens. This ambition got him to the field of UX where he enjoys finding out what people need, building it and having a good cry after testing.
He is curious and if you give him a stick and a bear, he'll know what to do. He's not good at sports, so you might reconsider.

events.name: Technical SEO For Devs and Other Curious Tinkerers
events.description:
We are having the amazing Myriam Jessier all the way from Canada to teach us in a talk/workshop/QA about technical SEO. So please bring all your questions!

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup we require that you enter your details in the rsvp. (security badges)

About the event:

This talk is short, solide recap of all important technical SEO points anyone creating a website needs to know. Most of think that some magical SEO plugin will fix everything...that‚Äôs not the case. Get a crashcourse on how to optimize your code to make it bot-friendly! If you grapply with online visibility or make sure your JS is read by Google, come on over.

About Myriam Jessier

If Myriam was a :
- museum piece : she'd be a T-rex fossil
- a book : Aloha from hell
- a condiment : wasabi mayonnaise

Myriam is :
- a technical marketer with arcane JS knowledge
- named her tiny wiener dog Fat Back instead of Chorizo
- has worked with AR, VR, EV, SEO and other industries with acronyms her mom doesn't care about
events.how_to_find_us: We will gather at the entrance, if you are not on time, please reach out to Madlaina via Meetup Messages

events.name: Overcoming Impostor Syndrome (Training)
events.description:
Impostor Syndrome is the feeling that you aren‚Äôt actually qualified for the work you are doing and will be discovered as a fraud. It is prevalent among women in open tech/culture, many of whom have been socialised to value others‚Äô opinion of their work above their own.

The Overcoming Impostor Syndrome training was created by the Ada Initiative. https://adainitiative.org/

This training‚Äôs aim is to fight and overcome impostor syndrome. There will be a presentation and we will do hands-on training in groups.

events.name: DevFest Switzerland 2018
events.description:
IMPORTANT: For this event, you need to have a ticket! Tickets are only available here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-2018-tickets-45157555464#tickets

Are you a tech enthusiast, a student or an IT professional and want to take a deep dive into cutting edge technologies like Machine Learning, AR, Mobile Development and more? Or do you want to explore these technologies and don‚Äôt know where to start? Perhaps you are even facing a very specific challenge that you want to solve and would like to talk to an expert in one of these fields?

Don‚Äôt panic!

This year, during week 42, the DevFest Switzerland 2018 comes to the rescue. On 20. / 21. October 2018, the third DevFest Switzerland will take place in Rapperswil and you are welcome to join this journey with the GDG Z√ºrich, Women Techmakers Switzerland, GDG Fribourg and GDG Bern.

Our world class speakers will provide you with a hitchhiker's guide to the galaxies of Machine Learning, AR, Mobile Development and more! In our workshops, you will be able to get hands on experience with likeminded people. And if you should feel tired at some point, there is always the Retro-Gaming Corner, which will refresh your mind to find your answers to the ultimate question of life, the universe and everything ;)

Don‚Äôt hesitate and get your ticket now: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-2018-tickets-45157555464#tickets

The ticket will include the following
- 13 sessions over 2 days
- Workshops to join
- Food and coffee
- Swags

More information about the event can be found here: https://devfest.ch/

We are happy to have you on board! Cu there!

events.name: Hacktoberfest Zurich 2018

venue.name: Impact Hub Colab - Loft Corner, 4th floor

events.description:
Details
In the spirit of open source and Hacktoberfest we come together to work on open source software, to give back to the community. This is all about encouraging meaningful contributions to the open source ecosystem, for beginners and veterans alike. We will organize a place to work with internet access, and provide guidance to help you contribute to open source.

# Agenda

The event starts between 17:30-18:30, the rest of the agenda will be announced soon.

# Location

Impact Hub Colab, Loft Corner, 4th floor
Sihlquai 131
8005 Z√ºrich

# Rules

To get a shirt, you must make five pull requests (PRs) between October 1‚Äì31 in any timezone. PRs can be to any public repo on GitHub, not just the ones highlighted. The PR must contain commits you made yourself. PRs reported by maintainers as spam or that are automated will be marked as invalid and won't count towards the shirt. This year, the first 50,000 of you can earn a T-shirt (compared with 30,000 in 2017).

# Values

Hacktoberfest guiding values:

* Everyone is welcome
* Quantity is fun, quality is key
* Short term actions, long term impact

# What to Bring

You need to bring your own laptop.

# Other

You can start hacking before the event, and continue hacking after the event. And if you cannot make the event, we still encourage you to participate in the global Hacktoberfest: https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/

Please read our Events Code of Conduct (http://do.co/hacktoberconduct) before attending. Happy hacking!

events.name: DACHFest 2018 (DevFest DACH) - Making a difference
events.description:
For this year's DevFest season, GDG and WTM communities of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland are all working together to organize our largest event yet: DACHFest!

DACHFest is a two-day DevFest conference focused on making a difference. Meet technology experts in emerging fields like AR/VR and Voice UI, discover all the different ways in which technology is transforming lives, find out how to make your apps and websites accessible and friendly towards everyone, learn the secrets of building and nurturing a diverse community ‚Äî let our speakers surprise and inspire you! And don't forget to make new friends: there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people passionate about your favorite things. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Join us in Munich on November 10‚Äì11 for two days full of talks, workshops, showcases, networking, and fun!

DACHFest is a paid event, but diversity scholarships are available for people who belong to underrepresented groups in tech or cannot afford a ticket. (apply here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfUErEWRxKJ4I9GJ3O3-QXeI8_SavoVxTS7jTj1Emv5OMdZgg/viewform)

Website: https://dachfest.com
Tickets: https://ti.to/dachfest/2018
Twitter: https://twitter.com/dachfest

events.name: International Womens Day: Cloud Study Jam @Google
events.description:
IMPORTANT: REGISTER HERE TO ATTEND: https://events.withgoogle.com/csj-for-wit/

8th of March is International Women's day üéâ this needs proper celebration!

This year, we organize a Cloud Study Jam event together with Google. You will get free access to online training, as well as help from Googlers to learn about the cloud. Even more, you will get free access to these online trainings for 30 more days, so that you can complete your trainings at your convenience.

There is no previous knowledge required. We have trainings for all levels. So everyone is very welcome to join!

Snacks and drinks will be provided.

Please register here for the Zurich event: https://events.withgoogle.com/csj-for-wit/. Keep in mind that we can only accept attendees with registration.

We are looking forward to welcoming you to this International Women's Day Celebration ‚ú®ü•≥

events.name: Introduction to GraphQL Workshop
events.description:
GraphQL has become very popular these days. But what is it? Why is everyone so crazy about it? What are the advantages of GraphQL compared to more traditional APIs like REST?

At this meetup, we will introduce GraphQL as an option for serverless and reliable backends. We will have an introduction about GraphQL and then build a small sample project with Hasura's GraphQL API.

Don't worry - no previous knowledge of GraphQL is needed! We will start from scratch.

Seats are limited, so that people can really learn and get proper attention. So if you sign up, please make sure that you can make it.

If you have a laptop, please bring it, otherwise you can work with someone who has a laptop.

Looking forward to welcoming you to the workshop!
events.how_to_find_us: Community salon on the level of Auer caf√©

events.name: Building smarter solutions with Machine Learning, from magic to reality
events.description:
Nowadays everybody talks about machine learning. Even it looks like magic, it doesn't have to be like this. Join us on the meetup in which Laurent from Google shows us how to do it without magic. This meetup is targeted to developers and not magicians or experts, so reserve a seat and just come by. If you cannot join, please cancel your registration and enable somebody else to join.
This Meetup is hosted by Google Developers Group and Women Techmakers.

Outline:
‚ÄúAny sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.‚Äù ‚Äî Arthur C Clarke
Well, machine learning can look like magic, but we don't need to be data scientists or ML researchers to develop with ML. So, what about making our solutions smarter without any knowledge of AI? In this session, we‚Äôll see how to transform or extract information from text, image, audio & video with the latest ML APIs, how to train an AutoML custom model, and we‚Äôll be active players of a live demo. Don't put your smartphone on airplane mode!

Agenda:
18:45 - 19:00 welcome
19:00 - Start Talk from Laurent
After that Questions, Apero, and networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

Bio:
Laurent is a developer passionate about software, hardware, science and anything shaping the future. He works for Google where he ecstatically explores cloud technologies. In a previous life, he pioneered the ebook industry, co-created the first European ebook reader, and co-founded Bookeen. He now enjoys sharing his passion in international conferences. You can find him on Twitter at @PicardParis.

events.name: Flutter #1: Create beautiful apps in record time
events.description:
Flutter is Google‚Äôs mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android with the same codebase in record time. It is used by developers and organizations around the world and it is free and open source.

In this event, you will get to know about Flutter. No previous knowledge is required. It is the first event of two where you get a full understanding of Flutter.
The second event: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/260275037

Agenda:
18.00 - 18.10 - Welcome
18.15 - 18.35 - Introduction to Flutter, Katarina Sheremet, Google Developer Expert in Flutter. She will tell us about the features of Flutter, explains the difference between Stateful and Stateless widgets, and show how to use Flutter tools to boost your development cycle.
18.35 - 19.15 - Creating cool UIs with Flutter, Sergi Mart√≠nez, Google Developer Expert in Flutter. An introduction to the common elements to be used when creating UIs in Flutter. Starting from the ground and step-by-step, we will review how to create a UI with the basic widgets, including lists, cards, images, etc. We will see different strategies on how to layout elements, including Rows, Columns, Stacks, and other Widgets from the Flutter framework.
19.15 - 20.30 - Networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

events.name: Flutter #2: Create beautiful apps in record time
events.description:
Flutter is Google‚Äôs mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android with the same codebase in record time. It is used by developers and organizations around the world and it is free and open source.

In this event, you will get to know about Flutter. It is the second event of two where you get a full understanding of Flutter.
First event: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/260274293/

Agenda:
18.00 - 18.10 - Welcome

18.15 - 18.55 - Booting Fuchsia, burying Android, Rub√©n Serrano. How many Android devices can update to the newest OS version after 2 years? In case you are a mobile developer, how it feels supporting different OS versions that can behave completely different? How many times have you wished to use any language as a first-class citizen for mobile development? In this talk we will show how Fuchsia addresses the former problems with its modular design and its new kernel created from scratch (no Linux here); its use of AI; and its UI SDK, based on Flutter, which also lets you reuse the app for Android and iOS (and other desktop OS and the web in the near future). But it doesn't stop here, and Fuchsia will be the OS for any kind of device, from IoT devices to the Cloud.

19.00 - 19.45 - New kid in the BLoC, Filipe A. Barroso. The goal of this talk is that the end of 40 minutes you will have a better understanding of state management in Flutter, through BLoC, InheritedWidget & Scoped model, Redux, and less known MobX. So that in your next Flutter project you will have better confidence in why you pick one and not the other.

19.45 - 20.30 - The sharp Corners of BLoC, Katarina Sheremet.

20.30 - 21.00 - Networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your real first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

events.name: Kubeflow explained: Portable machine learning on Kubernetes
events.description:
We will have guest speaker:
Michelle Casbon is Senior Programs Developer Engineer and will speak on Kubeflow. After the talk we have food and drinks provided by Google for optimal Networking conditions!

REGISTRATION REQUIRED:
https://forms.gle/FcE8RNp2AKGkYVct6

Practically speaking, some of the biggest challenges facing ML applications are composability, portability, and scalability. The Kubernetes framework is well suited to address these issues, which is why it‚Äôs a great foundation for deploying ML products. Kubeflow is designed to take advantage of these benefits.

Kubeflow makes it easy for everyone to develop, deploy, and manage portable, scalable ML everywhere and supports the full lifecycle of an ML product, including iteration via Jupyter notebooks. It removes the need for expertise in a large number of areas, reducing the barrier to entry for developing and maintaining ML products. The composability problem is addressed by providing a single, unified tool for running common processes such as data ingestion, transformation, and analysis, model training, evaluation, and serving, as well as monitoring, logging, and other operational tools. The portability problem is resolved by supporting the use of the entire stack either locally, on-premise, or on the cloud platform of your choice. Scalability is native to the Kubernetes platform and leveraged by Kubeflow to run all aspects of the product, including resource-intensive model training tasks.
Michelle Casbon demonstrates how to build a machine learning application with Kubeflow. By providing a platform that reduces variability between services and environments, Kubeflow enables applications that are more robust and resilient, resulting in less downtime, quality issues, and customer impact. Additionally, it supports the use of specialized hardware such as GPUs, which can reduce operational costs and improve model performance. Join Michelle to find out what Kubeflow currently supports and the long-term vision for the project.
events.how_to_find_us: The room is located at the Google Offices, Kasernenstrasse 95, directly next to the main station. (4th floor)

events.name: Breaking a world record using GCP: most accurate value of Pi
events.description:
Emma Haruka Iwao is a Japanese computer scientist and cloud developer advocate at Google. In 2019 Iwao calculated the world's most accurate value of pi (œÄ); which included 31.4 trillion digits, far past the previous record of 22 trillion.

REGISTRATION REQUIRED => https://forms.gle/ZwbZzQThHnYAMHuL8

18:30 ‚Äì Welcome by WTM Switzerland
18:45 ‚Äì Grazia Frontoso, Data Analytics Specialist
"Why Google Cloud Platform ‚Äì an introduction"
19:00 ‚Äì Emma Haruka Iwao, Cloud Developer Advocate
"Breaking a world record using GCP: most accurate value of Pi"
19:45 ‚Äì Food, Drinks and Networking

Abstract:
We have calculated 31.4 trillion digits of Pi in 2019 and broke the world record in the Pi computation. The process took about four months and 200 TiB of storage. Record-breaking Pi calculations have traditionally been done on supercomputers and special-made hardware, but we did it on Cloud for the first time. This talk will discuss the nature of the calculation, the architecture, challenges and techniques, and of course the brief history of Pi computation. Calculating Pi has been the speaker's childhood dream and this talk will also explain how the small dream grew to the new world record.

Background:
As a child, Iwao became interested in pi. She was inspired by Japanese mathematicians, including Yasumasa Kanada. She studied computer science at the University of Tsukuba, She was awarded the Dean's Award for Excellence in 2008, before starting graduate studies in computing. Her master's dissertation considered high performance computer systems.After graduating, Iwao took on several software engineering positions, working on site reliability for Panasonic, GREE and Red Hat.

Career
After joining Google in 2015, Iwao became a Cloud Developer Advocate in 2017. She originally worked for Google in Tokyo, before moving to Seattle in 2019. Iwao focuses on the use of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), as well as supporting application developers. She works to make cloud computing accessible for everyone, creating online demos and teaching materials.

events.name: How to find your dream job
events.description:
Following popular demand in meetups on social skills and career development, we are organizing a dream job meetup ‚ú®‚ù§

We will have two presentations: one from the side of the interviewee and one from the side of the interviewer.

How I found my dream job - Marion Schleifer (Developer Experience Engineer at Hasura)

Marion has had over 30 interviews in the tech industry in the last 1.5 years. Having interviewed with companies ranging from startups to large corporations, she will share her experience, learnings and conclusions. Also, she will share how the interview process made her realize what she really wants to do and how she landed her dream job at Hasura.

How you should apply for your dream job - Marco Mahrer (Recruiter at GetYourGuide)

Marco is Senior Tech Recruiter at GetYourGuide. He will share what is important in the interview process:
- How to write your CV
- How to prepare for your interview
- What to focus on during the interview

Agenda:
- 18:00 - 18:30: Welcome & apero
- 18:30 - 19:15: Talk 1: How I found my dream job (Marion)
- 19:15 - 20:00: Talk 2: How you should apply for your dream job (Marco)
- 20:00 - 21:30: Apero & networking

We can't wait to welcome you to this meetup üôåüòç

events.name: Authenticity and Vulnerability ‚Äì Keys or Obstacles to Career Success?
events.description:
Being authentic and showing vulnerability at work ‚Äì keys to your success in the workplace or sure-fire ways to kick you off the career ladder? We will explore this question by looking at what social studies have to say. To help us put theory into practice, we will deep dive into real stories of what can happen when people bring their authenticity and vulnerability to the workplace.

Agenda:
19.00 - 19:15 - Opening
19:15 - 19:50 - Authenticity and Vulnerability ‚Äì Keys or Obstacles to Career Success? by Cristina Moraru.
19:50 - 21:00 - Networking

No snack and drinks will be provided at the event. They can be bought downstairs at the cafe.

About Cristina:

I left my home country at the age of 18 to study experimental psychology without exactly knowing what I had embarked on. I fell in love with social research. Once I finished my studies I changed countries again to diversify my social research expertise, this time by studying educational sciences. And when that was done, I allowed love to again determine my next step ‚Äì I relocated to Switzerland to join my partner. Through trials, triumphs and tribulations, I discovered the life I truly want to create for myself: empowering women to live their happiest lives, drawing from my research superpowers, obsession with self-development and personal experience living abroad. This is why I founded Worthful Woman, a research- and experience-led platform supporting women who followed their partners to Switzerland in crafting happy lives: www.worthfulwoman.com.
events.how_to_find_us: The community salon at Auer cafe

events.name: Always working for the customer
events.description:
At this Meetup, we are going to discuss how Product Managers and Product Designers work together to solve customer needs.

We will have two presentations:

- How design can facilitate creative problem-solving. - Cansu Tecimer Product Designer Manager at GetYourGuide. She will talk about some of the tools and techniques used at GetYourGuide to identify potential problems and solutions, how to create buy-in with the team and Product Manager, how to create transparency around the design process, and some techniques to ensure quality implementation.

- How do PMs ensure they are always solving the right and most relevant problems? - Iulia Porneala, Product Manager at www.ProductManagementFestival.com.

Agenda
6:30 - 7:00 Networking and Snacks
7:00 - 7:30 How design can facilitate creative problem-solving. (Cansu)
7:30 - 7:45 Snacks and Break
7:45 - 8:15 How do PMs ensure they are always solving the right and most relevant problems? (Iulia)
8:15 - 9:00 Networking

About Speakers:

Cansu is a Product Designer Manager living in Berlin. Currently working at GetYourGuide, she had previously led the digital product design team at HelloFresh. She believes that the key to building great products is through engaged teams working on problems that really matter to them and their users. The way designers are trained to think can be a major facilitator in this quest.

Iulia is based in Switzerland currently leading Product Management Festival, one of the biggest product management conference and education provider in Europe and APAC. Before that she was Head of Product Management at the security provider CyberGhost VPN, one of the biggest Romanian exits estimated at EUR 9.2 million.
Before starting in product management, Iulia studied engineering and worked as a software developer. Some of her passions include hiking, cooking and technology innovation.

events.name: Firebase Workshop with the Firebase Team from San Francisco
events.description:
We are delighted to be joined by two amazing engineers from the Firebase team, who visit us from the US especially for this meetup.

**Important**

BRING YOUR LAPTOP!

**Workshop description**

Diana and Rachel will lead a workshop in which participants can bring their own laptops and try out one of the most requested Firebase features, local emulation for testing and development. Participants will walk through writing Firestore security rules and a Firebase Function to make failing tests pass. In the process, participants will learn about local testing with Firebase, which is traditionally tricky for managed services; about how to extend the tests to become part of a CI setup; about securing a Firebase app, given the different security model; and how to build reliable and scalable Firebase Functions. Diana and Rachel are also happy to answer other questions about Firebase.

**Diana's Bio**

Diana Tkachenko is the engineering lead for Cloud Functions for Firebase. Prior to working on the functions team, Diana worked on Firebase Hosting. Read more about her awesome work on the Firebase blog, her LinkedIn, or watch a "Meet Firebase" video of how she became an engineer at https://youtu.be/C3bjBOZ0wbs. She also leads a learn-to-program blog at dtkachenko.blogspot.com.

**Rachel's bio**

Rachel Myers is an engineer working on Firebase Security Rules. Before joining Google, she founded a cloud deployment company and was an engineer at GitHub. In her free time, Rachel leads RailsBridge workshops to teach women Ruby and Rails, and gives talks about everything from performance monitoring to software architecture.

**Agenda**

18:15-18:30 Welcome & Ap√©ro
18:30-20:00 Workshop with Diana & Rachel
20:00-21:00 Ap√©ro & networking

events.name: Introduction to software testing
events.description:
Talk description

Caroline will talk about software testing and why software testing is so important, especially now that software is becoming more and more complex. She will introduce what software testing is and how to set up tests in projects. There will be an introduction on the different types of tests and their importance, as well as the importance to automate tests. She will talk about best practices during development, that will help you get fast feedback, less debugging time and more joy.

About the speaker

Caroline moved from the Netherlands to Switzerland this summer. As a freelancer she currently works remotely on a few private projects.
Prior to the location switch, she used to provide her expertise on software quality and automation on the fly, while being contracted as a software engineer at companies in the Netherlands like Leaseplan, the government and Persgroep.

events.name: Call for Papers CFP Writing Workshop

venue.name: ZHAW School of Engineering Standort Z√ºrich

events.description:
*** This is a joint meetup with the VoxxedDays Zurich conference organizers, Women Techmakers Switzerland, and other communities. RSVP is not enough, you need to get a free ticket from Eventbrite - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cfp-abstract-writing-workshop-tickets-78085540955 ***

A lot of conferences will require you to submit a Call For Papers (CFP), which means you write a short abstract about your unique talk idea. Your submission will then be reviewed by the conference organizers during the selection process. Many factors play into account if you get selected, so sometimes, it will take many applications.

This workshop is for anyone who wants to learn how to write a good CFP that has good chances of being selected. It is initiated by the VoxxedDays Zurich conference organizers to motivate new speakers from diverse backgrounds to participate in their CFP, which is closing on November 24th. At the end of the workshop, you can submit your abstract to VoxxedDays Zurich or any other conference of interest.

Why should I speak at a conference?
Attending conferences gives you many networking opportunities with your industry, potential clients, and new colleagues. Also, being a speaker provides you more exposure than a regular attendee. You will also be invited to exclusive events and premises complementing the conference, where you will meet international speakers and the event organizers. Speaking will make you approachable for attendee discussions and feedback, which will lead to new insights and ideas to bring home. You will gain reputation in your field, and it is also extremely beneficial for your company. Conferences often cover speaker travel and accommodation fees; this is great to grow your network internationally.

I don‚Äôt know what to speak about...
A common misconception is that only experts speak at conferences. However, the most important thing attendees seek is to learn about unknown concepts around technology and to get inspired. As individuals, we have unique perspectives, knowledge, and interests that we can share with others. In this workshop, we will help you brainstorm exciting topics that are tailored to you and find the right conference to apply to. Many conferences also offer first-time speaker mentoring, so you feel most prepared for your talk.

I am not good in front of crowds‚Ä¶
Many renowned speakers have stated that they are introverted and still get nervous before a presentation. Stage fright is entirely reasonable for most humans. For introverts, a conference can be exhausting. But if you avoid talking to anyone ‚Äì it can hurt your career and business. As a speaker, you will get approached by attendees, and you can skip the pressure of doing small-talk as you can jump right into a discussion about your field of interest. Access to speaker rooms enables introverts to have enough down-time away from the crowd.

events.name: POSTPONED TO UNDEFINED DATE: IWD special: Workshop "Getting started with VueJS"
events.description:
=======
POSTPONED till yet undefined date due to concerns around Coronavirus
=======

USE THIS FORM FOR REGISTRATION: https://forms.gle/QgTKsZBiy6RwioyC9

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Vue.js is a lightweight, modern JavaScript framework, with an unprecedented adoption rate, rich ecosystem and modern tooling. It powers all kinds of applications on the web and has quickly become the framework of choice for new products at Homegate.

So why not get your hands dirty and try Vue.js at the free full day course organized by WTM Switzerland? Join and learn the basics with Olga Skurativska, Homegate‚Äôs Senior Frontend Engineer.

Being a huge Vue.js fan, Olga has run a similar course for her company and is now looking to help fellow women techmakers get a head start in web development.

WHAT WILL I BE LEARNING?
We will cover topics like:
- Vue.js ecosystem and documentation
- Starting a new project
- Organizing your code into components
- Styling Vue.js applications
- and many more, all while working on creating a fully functional cocktail book website.

IS THIS FOR ME?
This course is for anyone willing to create awesome things on the web!

WHAT DO I NEED TO KNOW?
Course participants should have a basic command of HTML, CSS and JavaScript

WILL THERE BE FOOD?
We will take good care of you! There will be breakfast, lunch and evening drinks - all courtesy of our sponsors.

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
- A laptop with Node.js and yarn installed (no worries, we can help with installation)
- Laptop charger
- Your game face!

SIGNUP
We have limited seats available, so we encourage you to apply early by filling in this form: https://forms.gle/QgTKsZBiy6RwioyC9 We will notify you about your registration status before the event.

Because spots are limited, we kindly ask you only to sign up if you are sure you can make it. This way, we can assure that as many members as possible can join. If you register and something else comes up, please reach out to us, so that we can admit someone on the waiting list.

upcoming.name: Effective App Architecture and State Management in Flutter
upcoming.description:
AGENDA
‚Ä¢ Start Google Hangouts, Welcome & Networking
‚Ä¢ Effective App Architecture and State Management in Flutter by Salih G√ºler (40min.)
‚Ä¢ Networking & chat

From the day that Flutter is announced, a lot of companies decided to use it in their production environments. Most of these companies have used it for projects from scratch and as we all know, deciding on an architecture for a brand new application is quite hard. Luckily, Flutter has a lot of great alternative approaches that can be used according to the suitable use-case.
In this talk, we are going to go over the Flutter's State Management options, how we can use them and last but not least we will learn how we can put all of this information to create the best architecture for our application.

About the speaker: Salih is a Berlin based Senior Mobile Engineer who is a Google Developer Expert for Flutter and Dart. He likes sharing his knowledge with the people by mentoring aspiring developers, blogging and talking at conferences.

Flutter Z√ºrich Meetup: https://www.meetup.com/Flutter-Zurich/

upcoming.name: POSTPONED: VoxxedDays Zurich [External Event, Registration required]
upcoming.description:
[EVENT POSTPONED}
Due to the growing uncertainty in Switzerland about coronavirus and pending government announcements, the organizers have taken the difficult decision to postpone the conference until the 15th of September 2020.

Voxxed Days Zurich 2020
INSPIRE. HAVE FUN. REPEAT.

Mark the date: Tuesday, March 10th, 2020!

Voxxed Days Z√ºrich returns for the 5th time to Sihlcity Cinema on March 10th, 2020.

Check out the Line-Up and Schedule here:
https://voxxeddays.com/zurich/schedule/

WTM is currently receiving 10 free VDZ tickets for WTM members, therefore we send a big thank you to all the diversity sponsors:

- 2 offered by the organization team of VDZ
- 1 offered by our Program Committee member Katharine Beaumont
- 1 offered by WTM organizer Madlaina Kalunder
- 1 offered by speaker Oliver Drothom
- 1 offered by speaker Markus Winand
- 1 offered by speaker Marta Wi≈õniewska
- 1 offered by speaker Eric Torreborre
- 1 offered by speaker Theresa Mammarella
- 1 offered by speaker Mike Hartington

Please send us a message, if you would like to receive one of the diversity tickets.

Special thanks go to our amazing Program Committee and speakers for this success. You can see feedback and comments on Twitter and get updates on Voxxed Days Z√ºrich 2020 by following us @VoxxedZurich.
